article_text: WASHINGTON (AP) — States and counties may impose property taxes on Indian reservation land privately owned by Native Americans, the Supreme Court ruled today. By an 8-1 vote, the justices upheld such a tax imposed by Yakima County, Wash., on land within the Yakima Indian Reservation. But, by a separate, unanimous vote, the court barred the county from imposing an excise tax on the sale of such privately owned — or “fee” — land.
article_headline: Indian reservations Visually impaired man may pay property tax sues race organizers
